results.title: The Drought : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Ten farmers from the north-eastern region of Victoria reflect upon their lives within the context of one of the longest and most severe droughts the region has ever seen. In doing so, they highlight the things that have kept them there, whether it be family, community or the love of farming.
results.description: Ten farmers from the north-eastern region of Victoria reflect upon their lives within the context of one of the longest and most severe droughts the region has ever seen. In doing so, they highlight the things that have kept them there, whether it be family, community or the love of farming.
description_for_label: Ten farmers from the north-eastern region of Victoria reflect upon their lives within the context of one of the longest and most severe droughts the region has ever seen. In doing so, they highlight the things that have kept them there, whether it be family, community or the love of farming.

results.title: We came to an understanding
results.creator_credit: Ros Henning, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ros Henning loves her life of abundance on the farm. She has developed relationships with the sheep, worms and chickens that keep everything running smoothly.

results.title: That's farming
results.creator_credit: Michael Burston, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: For Michael Burston, leaving the city and taking up farming full time was a gradual process, and one not without obstacles. From virulent weeds to natural disasters, Burston was determined to pull through.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Burston, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: For Michael Burston, leaving the city and taking up farming full time was a gradual process, and one not without obstacles. From virulent weeds to natural disasters, Burston was determined to pull through.

results.title: Not without Val
results.creator_credit: Vin Shelly, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Vin Shelly has served the Shire of Chiltern for 20 years, and was shire president for three terms. He shares some of his interests over the years, as well as his main source of pride, the family farm.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vin Shelly, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: It's time to go
results.creator_credit: Cheryl Seymour, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Seymour family had struggled for years to keep the farm viable, despite rising interest rates, falling prices, droughts and fires. As the family got older and circumstances changed, it was time to make an important decision.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cheryl Seymour, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: The Seymour family had struggled for years to keep the farm viable, despite rising interest rates, falling prices, droughts and fires. As the family got older and circumstances changed, it was time to make an important decision.

results.title: Goods & chattels : the story of Theodor
results.creator_credit: Robert Voigt, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Robert Voigt recounts his rich family history and their connection to their farm in Beechworth. When his father, Henry, purchased more land, he received, as part of the goods and chattels in the contract, Theodor, a farm labourer. Theodor was a man of vast intelligence and mysterious origins.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Voigt, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Robert Voigt recounts his rich family history and their connection to their farm in Beechworth. When his father, Henry, purchased more land, he received, as part of the goods and chattels in the contract, Theodor, a farm labourer. Theodor was a man of vast intelligence and mysterious origins.

results.title: The Full bell curve
results.creator_credit: Paula Pippin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Paula Pippin and her husband told their friends they were moving to the country, the responses ranged from suspicion to outright hostility. But the Pippin family were on an adventure which would introduce them to the full bell curve of society.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paula Pippin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Dust dance
results.creator_credit: Judy Griffiths, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In 2000. Judy Griffiths took over her family farm. Having studied agriculture science, Griffiths was able to apply what she learnt to help her care for the land through some of the toughest times her farm has ever seen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Judy Griffiths, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Ants in the irrigation drippers
results.creator_credit: Jeanette Holloway, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In 1976, Jeanette and Arthur Holloway took over Arthur’s family farm in Chiltern, Victoria. There they began a partnership with two other families to grow kiwi fruit. Jeanette Holloway recounts the time there, the hardships and how the farm became her home.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeanette Holloway, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: In 1976, Jeanette and Arthur Holloway took over Arthur’s family farm in Chiltern, Victoria. There they began a partnership with two other families to grow kiwi fruit. Jeanette Holloway recounts the time there, the hardships and how the farm became her home.
